alert.note: Alert for Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 3:48PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Plumas County through 430 PM PDT... At 347 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Almanor Peninsula, or near Chester. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Prattville, Lake Almanor Country Club, Lake Almanor West, Lake Almanor Peninsula, Hamilton Branch, Canyondam, Lake Almanor, East Shore and Almanor. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If on or near Lake Almonor and Butte Valley Reservoir, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
